column4: Hi, I'm hoping someone can help me with getting my ethernet card connection to work. I have Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. Just transferred my HD into an old P2 box after my motherboard crapped out. Eveything is working except I can't connect to the network or internet.
what is the output of:  sudo lshw -C network    thanks
thanks, just a sec...
It is long, and I can't paste it as I'm on another box....
what is the product line of the wired interface
ok, and you are using the server OS (no X server)?
Is it hardy desktop?
not sure what you mean, I'm not terribly savy
yes but do you have a mouse pointer and such, a desktop gui?
When I try to run Firestarter I get eth1 is not ready
do you use a desktop OS? With a mouse pointer to click things with?
then your OS isn't supported now. Desktop support for Hardy died when Natty came out
the only way Hardy i now supported is on the server
sorry. its ubuntu 8.04 LTS
yes, there is no desktop support for hardy
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases
note how desktop support ie end of life
it's not, the server is supported until 2013, the desktop isn't
I suggest you upgrade or reinstall to at least Lucid
all earlier releases are no longer supported on the desktop
well first I need to get connected, or else I'll have to order a CD by mail...
